verses.text: There is a reproof that is not comely: Again, some man holdeth his tongue, and he \add is\add* wise.
It is much better to reprove, than to be angry secretly: And he that confesseth his fault shall be preserved from hurt.
How good \add is it,\add* when \add thou\add* art reproved, to shew repentance! For so shalt thou escape wilful sin.
\add As is\add* the lust of an eunuch to deflower a virgin; So \add is\add* he that executeth judgment with violence.
There is one that keepeth silence, and is found wise: And \add another\add* by much babbling becometh hateful.
Some man holdeth his tongue, because he hath not to answer: And some keepeth silence, knowing \add his\add* time.
A wise man will hold his tongue till \add he see\add* opportunity: But a babbler and a fool will regard no time.
He that useth many words shall be abhorred; And he that taketh to himself authority therein shall be hated.
There is a sinner that hath good success in evil \add things;\add* And there is a gain \add that turneth\add* to loss.
There is a gift that shall not profit thee; And there is a gift whose recompence \add is\add* double.
There is an abasement because of glory; And there is that lifteth up \add his\add* head from a low estate.
There is that buyeth much for a little, And repayeth it sevenfold.
A wise \add man\add* by \add his\add* words maketh himself beloved: But the graces of fools shall be poured out.
The gift of a fool shall do thee no good when thou hast \add it;\add* Neither yet of the envious for his necessity: For he looketh to receive many \add things\add* for one.
He giveth little, and upbraideth much; He openeth his mouth like a crier; To day he lendeth, and to morrow will he ask \add it\add* again: Such a one \add is\add* to be hated of God and man.
The fool saith, I have no friends, \add I\add* have no thank for \add all\add* my good \add deeds\add*, And they that eat my bread speak evil \add of me\add*.
How oft, and of how many shall he be laughed to scorn! For he knoweth not aright what it is to have; And it is all one unto him as if he had \add it\add* not.
To slip upon a pavement \add is\add* better than \add to slip\add* with the tongue: So the fall of the wicked shall come speedily.
An unseasonable tale Will always be in the mouth of the unwise.
A wise sentence shall be rejected \add when it cometh\add* out of a foolâ€™s mouth; For he will not speak it in due season.
There is that is hindered from sinning through want: And when he taketh rest, he shall not be troubled.
There is that destroyeth his own soul through bashfulness, And by accepting of persons overthroweth himself.
There is that for bashfulness promiseth to \add his\add* friend, And maketh him \add his\add* enemy for nothing.
A lie \add is\add* a foul blot in a man, Yet it is continually in the mouth of the untaught.
A thief \add is\add* better than \add a man\add* that is accustomed to lie: But they both shall have destruction to heritage.
The disposition of a liar \add is\add* dishonourable, And his shame \add is\add* ever with him.
A wise \add man\add* shall promote himself \add to honour\add* with \add his\add* words: And he that hath understanding will please great men.
He that tilleth his land shall increase his heap: And he that pleaseth great men shall get pardon for iniquity.
Presents and gifts blind the eyes of the wise, And stop up \add his\add* mouth that he cannot reprove.
Wisdom that is hid, and treasure \add that is\add* hoarded up, What profit \add is\add* in \add them\add* both?
Better \add is\add* he that hideth his folly Than a man that hideth his wisdom.
Necessary patience in seeking the Lord \add is\add* better Than he that leadeth his life without a guide.
